name: Brunch on the Bayou
author: SBASSETT4473
summary: This is an absolutely FANTASTIC brunch recipe. I typically serve it when family is visiting for the holidays as the majority is prepared the night before. Everyone loves it and ALWAYS wants the recipe!
ingredients: ½ (1 pound) loaf day old French bread, broken into small pieces
directions: Place sausage in a skillet over medium-high heat
Cook, stirring constantly until evenly browned
Spread bread pieces in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish
Drizzle melted butter over the bread pieces, then sprinkle in the cooked sausage
In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, white wine, Dijon mustard, and green onions
Season with black and red pepper
Pour the egg mixture over everything in the baking dish
Cover, and refrigerate 8 hours to overnight
Remove the dish from the refrigerator 30 minutes prior to baking to allow it to come to room temperature
Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Cover the dish with aluminum foil, and bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven
Then uncover, and bake for an additional 30 minutes
Remove from the oven, and spread sour cream over the top
Return to the oven for an additional 10 minutes, or until cheese is starting to brown slightly
